meanings.definition: The act of avoiding or abstaining from something.
meanings.sent1: Her eschewals of sugary treats helped her maintain a healthy diet.
meanings.sent2: His eschewals of conflict made him a peaceful person.
meanings.sent3: The cat's eschewals of water led to some creative bath time solutions.
meanings.sent4: His eschewals of the limelight made him a mysterious figure in the town.
meanings.sent5: The knight's eschewals of fear made him a fearless warrior on the battlefield.

meanings.definition: The practice of steering clear of or shunning certain things.
meanings.sent1: Their eschewals of gossip kept the workplace drama-free.
meanings.sent2: The monk's eschewals of material possessions were admirable.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's eschewals of bad jokes made his audience laugh even harder.
meanings.sent4: Her eschewals of negativity created a positive atmosphere around her.
meanings.sent5: The explorer's eschewals of the beaten path led him to amazing discoveries.
